item.title: Overwatch Player Spots Unusual Interaction with Busan Train
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Lucio player's unique wall-riding train maneuver on Busan is a flashy move that could catch enemies off guard in Overwatch 2.
  • Overwatch 2 continues to add classic maps like Busan, offering players new interactions and strategies to master.
  • By utilizing the wall-riding mechanic, one Lucio player was able to ride the passing train on Busan, showcasing a rare and exciting gameplay moment.

An Overwatch 2 player has spotted an unusual interaction with the Busan train after years of being a fan. The Control map Busan has been restored for Overwatch 2 from its 2018 appearance, but this clip highlights a helpful use for its train.

Before Overwatch 2 was released, the original title had 32 maps that included Assault, Escort, and Hybrid objectives. There were also 31 heroes to choose between, and the sequel features a constantly growing number, with Venture being the freshest addition. Overwatch was taken offline with the release of Overwatch 2 , initially leaving some maps out of the rotation. Blizzard continues to add classic maps to the sequel, Hanamura becoming Hanaoka in April. Among the updated maps is Busan, a location that includes an unusual train interaction that may benefit some players.

Related
Overwatch 2 Player Points Out Surprising Benefit To Playing D.Va

D.Va is a popular Overwatch 2 hero, and one player pointed out a surprising detail that makes her an even more interesting pick.

Reddit user TheRealOWFreqE recently shared a clip highlighting their experiences on the Overwatch 2 map Busan . The video begins from a Zarya's perspective as they approach the point and bubble a Lucio that seems to move erratically. It then shifts to the Lucio's point-of-view as he heals allies on the capture point while battling enemies. Avoiding an enemy Moira's Ultimate ability, the player jumps backward, making contact with a passing train at the precise time it comes through. This causes Lucio to wall-ride the train before being sent flying at the opposing team at the same speed as the locomotive.

How Did This Lucio Accomplish Their Speedy Maneuvers?

Lucio can run across walls when players hold the jump button while approaching them. This allowed Lucio to run along the train wall with split-second timing as it sped past the capture point, resulting in the Overwatch 2 Support hero moving backward and forward so rapidly. While some players may not see Busan in the standard map rotation, it's available in Custom game modes and has been upgraded for Overwatch 2 . According to TheRealOWFreqE, they had played Overwatch for eight years before ever encountering a Lucio maneuver comparable to this one. While it was a flashy maneuver, it's unclear if this Lucio movement confused the enemy team or resulted in victory for their squad.

Without the Busan train passing by as Lucio jumped towards it, this player may have simply jumped off the side of the map to their death. It's currently unclear why they were sent flying in two directions, but it seems related to the momentum of the vehicle. As Blizzard continues to update Overwatch 2 , this Lucio interaction with the train may be polished in a future patch.

item.title: NBA 2K24 Fan Makes Real Life Version of the Default Shoes
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans are amazed by a real-life recreation of the NBA 2K24 player character's default shoes.
  • NBA 2K24 is steadily improving with updates, setting the stage for potential big changes in NBA 2K25.
  • Customization options in NBA 2K24 go beyond shoes, with the latest update injecting new content and cosmetics.

A creative NBA 2K24 fan put together an impressive real-life version of the generic basketball sneakers the player character gets in the game. It's amusing because NBA 2K24 has far superior options when it comes to basketball shoes that one can recreate in real life, so customization jobs like these are generally left to other games like Pokemon , which only have the occasional sneaker collaboration with brands such as Skechers and Puma.

NBA 2K24 is the latest entry in 2K Sports' long-running basketball game franchise. While initially released to lukewarm reactions, steady updates have made the game much better. While there's not much buzz nor controversy surrounding NBA 2K24 , all eyes are on 2K to do something big for NBA 2K25 later this year.

Related
The Next NBA 2K Cover Athlete Feels Obvious

The Minnesota Timberwolves have a rising superstar who is making a strong case to be the next NBA 2K cover athlete for NBA 2K25

Redditor Flashy_Extreme8871, who is also a fashion designer, posted their amazing take on the "2K Generic" shoe over on r/NBA2k. It's not clear if they modded an existing basketball sneaker or cobbled one together from scratch, but the result is an impressive reconstruction of the admittedly unremarkable shoe in a Jordan-esque black and red colorway. The upper is made of a black nylon mesh that has the familiar 2K logo printed on the back, accented with a buttery red ankle collar and a leather toecap. The shoe's midsole, which looks similar to Nike's ZoomX tech, looks chunky and well-padded, while the sole pattern looks like a typical basketball sneaker's, all of which suggest that this may be a modified existing silhouette with superior craftsmanship.

There's Another 2K Generic Shoe Coming Soon

Redditors in the comments made jokes about the creation while praising it at the same time. Some have referenced how players who pour their VCs into stats in NBA 2K24 would still likely be rocking the 2K Generics. Some also think the real-life shoe is just as ugly as the in-game version, while most have expressed how cool it looks when done properly. Flashy_Extreme8871 mentioned that they'll be making the gray version of the shoe next.

NBA 2K24 offers a lot of customization options for players that go beyond shoes. The latest Season 7 update for NBA 2K24 which dropped last May 17 injected a lot more content into the game, satisfying those who are always looking for something new to play for. Other than stat changes and new MyTEAM cards, numerous cosmetics have been added to the MyCAREER mode.

Meanwhile, 2K Sports has the potential to make NBA 2K25 special later this year. 2024 has seen the amazing rise of award-winning college superstar Caitlin Clark, who's swept the basketball world by storm with her heroics in this year's NCAA women's basketball tournament. Her growing fanbase suggests that heavily featuring Caitlin Clark on NBA 2K25 would be the best move to make in order to revitalize the franchise, and it's safe to assume that the company may be keeping a close eye on her career.

item.title: Destiny 2 Player Points Out Why Hand Cannons Make No Sense
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players find Destiny 2's unrealistic weapon design amusing, with some flaws making real-life use impossible.
  • Multiple hand cannons in the game have a glaring structural flaw, a low barrel that doesn't align with the hammer.
  • While some Destiny guns resemble real-life firearms, they often use technology that wouldn't function in reality.

The Destiny 2 player community is discussing some of the more unusual aspects of the game's weapon design. Players also highlighted other flaws in the guns of Destiny 2 that might make them difficult or impossible to use as real-life firearms.

Destiny and Destiny 2 are unusual outliers in the annals of military and sci-fi-themed shooter games, in part due to the game's premise, which takes its narrative closer to the realm of fantasy stories. The endlessly revived Guardians of the Last City constantly battle against supernatural threats like the Hive and the Taken, and enemies that use techniques so far removed from recognizable science that they're closer to magic. By contrast, though Guardians also use magic-like powers and occasionally wield swords and glaives, their main weapons are almost always firearms, often with designs inspired by or evoking real-life guns seen in military inventories or movie prop houses.

Related
10 Destiny 2 Weapons That Players Would Love To See Returning

Many Destiny 2 players would be delighted to see the following weapons make a grand return to Bungie's game.

One player has pointed out that those designs don't always make a lot of sense in the real world. User patrick505883 on the Destiny 2 subreddit highlighted a commonly seen design element in Destiny 2 hand cannons that doesn't seem practical from the standpoint of real-world firearm design.

Destiny 2 Hand Cannon Design Seems Physically Impossible

The element pointed out by patrick505883 has to do with the general structure of a common hand cannon visual template seen on weapons like the Fatebringer from the Vault of Glass raid or even Exotic-tier weapons like Cayde-6's Ace of Spades. Like most other hand cannons in the game, these weapons follow the rough structure of a traditional revolver pistol, such as a real-life Colt Python. However, some designs feature a barrel slung low and aligned with the bottom of the revolver's cylinder. Patrick505883 pointed out that the hammer of the Destiny 2 hand cannon is placed high enough to strike the top round in the cylinder, not the bottom one, making it non-functional in real life.

Fellow Destiny players were amused by the observation, and brought up other Destiny weapon designs that were nonsensical. Many posted a humorous image of the Conspirator scout rifle from the launch-era Destiny 2 Leviathan raid . The Conspirator's stock had a design flaw that ensured that no bullet inside its magazine would physically be able to make it into the barrel, much less be able to fire at enemies. Others pointed out that Destiny guns don't necessarily use what would be recognizable firearm technology, even if they occasionally resemble an existing gun. Some more knowledgeable users also mentioned that there are some real-life revolvers that have a low barrel and a highly placed cocking lever that merely looks like a firing hammer, like the real-life Chiappa Rhino and Mateba Autorevolver, making such designs theoretically viable, if unlikely to function as they do in the game.

item.title: Star Citizen is Currently Free to Play, But Only For a Limited Time
item.description:
Highlights

  • Star Citizen is available to play for free until May 29, allowing skeptical gamers to try it out without spending money.
  • The game has faced controversy throughout its 12-year development but continues to break fundraising records.
  • To continue playing after the free trial, players must purchase a game package that includes a digital download and a spaceship.

Star Citizen , the long-in-development space MMO from Cloud Imperium Games, is currently available to play for free, but only for a short period of time. This is the perfect opportunity for gamers who are unsure if they'd like Star Citizen to give the game a shot without spending a single penny.

Ever since a playable build of the game was first released to the public, Star Citizen has been laced with controversy after controversy throughout its 12-year-run. The development of Cloud Imperium Games' debut title has lasted for more than a decade, and over those years, it's accrued hundreds of millions of dollars from crowdfunders and investors alike. Despite all that, however, a release window for the game is still nowhere in sight. That hasn't stopped Star Citizen from breaking fundraising records , though, as the game recently raised $3.5 million in just 24 hours. Regardless of the contention surrounding it, this goes to show that Star Citizen still maintains a dedicated fanbase to this day. And now, gamers who are skeptical of the title can try it out for themselves.

Related
Star Citizen Confirms Major Squadron 42 Update

CitizenCon 2023 revealed the most comprehensive deep dive for Squadron 42 in years, as Star Citizen's single-player campaign edges closer to release.

In a post on the official Star Citizen website , Cloud Imperium Games revealed that its space MMO is going free-to-play for a short period of time, beginning on May 17 and ending on May 29. The free trial is intended to tie in with Star Citizen 's Invictus Launch Week celebrations, which happen around the same time annually. This year's event not only gives gamers the opportunity to play Star Citizen for free for a limited time , it also allows them to test out the 87 military vehicles in the game at no additional cost. In addition, those who use referral codes to invite their friends to play Star Citizen during the Invictus Launch Week will be granted an additional 5,000 United Earth Credits.

Star Citizen's Free to Play Period Will Give Skeptical Gamers the Opportunity to Try It Out

Those who want to continue playing Star Citizen after testing it out during the free trial will have to learn how to purchase the game first because, unlike other MMOs, buying a copy of Cloud Imperium's debut title is a bit more complicated than usual. Instead of buying Star Citizen individually, players will have to purchase a game package that includes both a digital download for the MMO and a spaceship of some sort, among other things. This will set players back a minimum of $45 on average, though those who really enjoy the game can buy more expensive bundles. Gamers should be warned, though, as Star Citizen is infamous for having ship bundles that cost a ridiculous amount of real money .

The last few months have been a rather interesting time f or Star Citizen , in both a positive and negative way. On one hand, Cloud Imperium Games recently released a huge Alpha update that added the first native animals to the game, which impressed many fans. On the other, though, the developers behind the ambitious MMO were just hit with layoffs and accusations of workplace toxicity. Regardless of whether it's good or bad news, it seems like Star Citizen will remain a hot topic within the gaming community for years to come.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Player Points Out Surprising Benefit To Playing D.Va
item.description:
Highlights

  • D.Va has reduced headshot damage outside her mech in Overwatch 2, making her a strong tank pick.
  • Tanks in Overwatch 2 recently received tweaks like a 25% headshot damage reduction to increase survivability.

An attentive Overwatch 2 player has discovered that D.Va has reduced headshot damage outside her mech. Overwatch 2 has many heroes that are popular with players, including D.Va. The beloved hero is a solid tank pick in Overwatch 2 's current meta, offering a good combination of high survivability and damage.

D.Va is one of the heroes from the original Overwatch roster who fights alongside her trusty mech. But while other tanks like Reinhardt, Sigma, and Winston wear powerful armor, D.Va distinguishes herself by having the ability to leave her mech thanks to her passive. Once outside, D.Va can continue the fight by damaging opponents with the Light Gun. D.Va can make surprising plays in Overwatch 2 , and carry fights when in the hands of the right player. Now, thanks to a surprising discovery, Overwatch 2 players discovered that D.Va is a little stronger than they anticipated.

Related
Overwatch 2 Reveals New Twitch Drop Rewards

Overwatch 2 launches a new Twitch Drops campaign, revealing what rewards players will earn by watching their favorite streamers.

In a surprising twist, Reddit user ddaammaaii discovered that D.Va outside her mech has reduced headshot damage. The player used Overwatch 2 's Practice Range to make a comparison between D.Va and Tracer, two Overwatch 2 characters with the same health (175). They discover that while Tracer is killed after five headshots, D.Va takes seven headshots to die, thanks to inheriting the tanks' headshot damage reduction when not using outside her mech.

Overwatch 2 Tanks Got Several Tweaks This Year

With the release of the May 14 patch, Blizzard made a new round of changes to Overwatch 2 tanks. Now, the tanks' role passive gives a 25% damage reduction against critical headshots, and knockback resistance has been increased from 30% to 50%. According to the devs, the adjustment was made to help reduce the feeling that tanks are taken out too quickly by Overwatch 2 heroes with high burst damage. This year, tanks got other important changes, such as the 50 HP boost, and the much-talked-about addition of the self-healing passive in Overwatch 2 . With it, Blizzard allowed tank mains to be more self-sufficient and less dependent on their support.

While it's unknown whether the headshot damage reduction outside the mech is an intentional design choice, this isn't the first time Overwatch 2 players have discovered that D.Va keeps buffs inside or outside the mech. In the comments, one Overwatch 2 player noted that D.Va also keeps the knockback effect outside the mech. With the Overwatch 2 x Porsche crossover underway, this may be a good time for Overwatch 2 players to test D.Va's potential while securing the hero's latest skin.
